title: My Client resolution keeps resetting, and in turn resets my desktop as well
body:
Every time afer a game, my clients resolution gets reset from 1280x720 to 1024x576, and I'm struggling to find a reaosn why, and also my desktop icons get realligned due to this bug. It should be this: https://gyazo.com/83b65493cd76aad95857cd1617f442cd

but gets changed to this https://gyazo.com/83b65493cd76aad95857cd1617f442cd

After every single game. It also changes the resolution of my internet browser if i alt tab out of game.

I've reinstalled, launched the torubleshooter, I've even deleted setting files and set my settings up from scratch again, nothing is working. 

Please someone, have a solution.

replies.body:
I was having this same issue and found a resolution for myself. I had to check "Disable display scaling on high DPI settings" under the compatibility tab for LeagueClient.exe. Also make sure that "Run as Administrator" is checked as well. I hope this fixes things for you all. This was bugging the hell out of me. 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

@Dirty Gangplank: Is your setup similar to mine, or should I make my own thread?

OKAY, So I've been narrowed down the problem quite a bit! I have a high resolution monitor, so I down-res the game so the visuals look more appropriate. 

My client is set to 1600x900.

I go into a game and my resolution is changed to the non-native monitor resolution of 2400x1600 

I end the game, my monitor returns to 3000x2000,  and the 1600x900 client acts funky.

[Screenshot Evidence.](https://imgur.com/a/fNlku)

The screenshot links are the same.  >.>   There is a specific setting fils that holds the config for the client.  Reinstall the game would keep these folders, so it doesn't get impacted.  

---- 

Log into the game client.

Close the client

Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config

Look for LCUlocalpreferences.yaml

Delete it, then restart the client!

Your client may reload at a different scale, but you can holy  Ctrl and  tap + or - to make it bigger.

----

I hope that helps!
